title.narrative: 2.1 SOCIAL SERVICE AND CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: Comprehensive child-centred and equity-focused integrated social services and child protection system and juvenile justice system scaled-up nationally for safe and secure home, community and schools, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, adolescent girls and boys especially the most vulnerable have benefited from an improved skill-driven formal and non- formal education system, increased opportunity for civic engagement and participation, and strengthened protective environment from all forms of violence, exploitation and abuse for a smooth transition to adulthood

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF LABOR AND SOCIAL PROTECTION OF POPULATION
STATE COMMITTEE ON FAMILY WOMAN AND CHILDREN

related-activity.ref: 0310/A0/06/882 2. INVESTING IN THE SECOND DECADE OF LIFE AND THE TRANSITION TO ADULTHOOD

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Comprehensive child-centred and equity-focused integrated social services and child protection system and juvenile justice systemscaled-up nationally for safe and secure home, community and schools

description.narrative: UNICEF’s technical support and advocacy initiatives to build and strengthen child-centred and equity-focused integrated social services system and alternative care models have significantly contributed to the development of social services and accelerated childcare reforms on prevention of institutionalization. UNICEF’s initiation of Child Protection in Emergency (CPiE) services, in the context of conflict escalation and COVID-19 pandemic, has increased the access of vulnerable children and women living in rural areas to high-quality Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Services (MHPSS) and increased public awareness on mental health and violence issues, and how to access to services. ;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2022
